review_title: Sourcing and Procurement - poor leadership. Stay away!!
pros: FedEx as a whole is a good company. Great benefits and recently has been doing great with revenue.
cons: The Sourcing and Procurement org has serious leadership issues. Morale is low and has been consistently so over the years as reported on the annual survey that team members complete. Leadership micromanages everyone's work which leads to people not feeling like their leaders trust them to do a good job and nothing is ever good enough. They will also grill, berate and demoralize team members on the weekly update calls with stakeholders during the meeting! I've never seen anything like it in all my career. This has contributed to a very high turnover rate in the last few years. They also keep piling work on to the team members that are still here. Not only will you work on your project but you will take over those that quit as well. And the expectation to complete these projects are the same no matter if you have to work all day and into the night. They don't care. If you want to work at FedEx, look for roles in other organizations in the company.

review_title: Great salary and opportunity for advancement
pros: Competitive salary and the people are awesome. Work from home allowed but they also have really nice campuses with benefits available such as cafeteria and gym. Reasonable dental and vision. 401k and stock options also available
cons: Very disappointed at FedEx's health plan options. I expected more reasonable premiums and coverage options considering fedex is such a big, well known organization. HRA and HSA accounts are available; however The plans are not so great. Premiums are high especially for plan options to be either HSA or Coinsurance (no copays) where employees are required to pay 20-30% plus deductible for going to the doctor for anything other than preventative.

Customers get treated terribly, delivery service is poor and the Customer Service team are impossible to get hold of and when customers do get them they get no information and they come back to the account managers ranting and raving. 

Standard promotion of a 'great culture' through wellness emails and mental health emails when in reality peoples mental health is generally affected by the ludricrous daily targets. 

Experienced staff are treated like interns.

review_title: FedEx is a great corporation but has drifted away from their core principles of PSP
job_title: Strategic Development Account Executive in Stamford, CT
pros: FedEx was founded on the principles of People-Service-Profit (PSP). PSP means that if you take care of your people and provide a great service you will make a profit. It's great to work for a company that values their people. FedEx has great people. FedEx's lives by "the Purple Promise": I will make every FedEx experience outstanding. The Purple Promise is an Excellent Mantra and business "Golden Rule". Working sales at FedEx because you provide great value to client corporations. As a result the relationships become very close. Clients value AE's as "Trusted Partners". This is a great way to sell.
cons: FedEx has lost a step. Technology is the main area where FedEx is behind. Many times FedEx is not up to speed with customer needs and is unable to keep pace with smaller more current nimble competetitive companies in the marketplace. With margins thin, FedEx seems to need to streamline their operation but is unable to do so without hurting the reliability that they're known for. Instead of being their own worst critic the company has listened to Wall Street type critics who have caused them to move from PSP to shareholder gains as their main purpose.

pros:
You can certainly get a good workout.
Mindless work.
cons: When working the line, you are required to work at a very fast pace, you need to scan every package that flys by you to find packages for your line. When working in peak season for example, the load of packages every night is immense- working at the pace they do, and the accuracy they demand is not human. Managers constantly walk the line, scanning packages to see which ones weren’t pulled off so they can yell at the person responsible. Other managers also walk on catwalks above the warehouse and yell at you down below, if they notice you slowing down. Peak season is crazy, and FedEx at the location I worked at genuinely did not care if you threw the boxes, regardless if they are fragile. The warehouse I worked at, closed later the next year- no wonder!

review_title: Do NOT waste your time unless you love stress
job_title: Specialty Premier Customer Service Representative (1Call/FOC) in Marion, VA
pros: THERE ARE NONE AT ALL
cons:
They train you one way and when you get on the floor its completely different and they scorn you for it. 

The pay is extremely low and the raises even lower. You start at $9.00/hr and receive a .25 cent raise once a year.

They are constantly changing their mind on how they want you to handle different situations. I would say that even after all this time we have been in this Covid19 mess they are still VERY unresponsive, unprepared and incapable of handling the situation with efficiency, dedication and some level of moral humanity, which brings me to my next point....

They do not care about you, you mental health and stability or family life. Its almost IMPOSSIBLE to get FMLA. If you are forced to take leave before FMLA is approved (say an emergency c-section or complication) you are pointed the entire time you are out and then fired with no regard to FMLA.

Hours are difficult if you have a family. No time off except Thanksgiving and Christmas. You WILL work all other holidays.

Management, ACCMs, HUB workers (especially in TN and ANCH are all rude and incompetent.

review_title: not a very great place to work at anymore unless you are in management.
pros:
Pension, 
401k match, 
Vacation days
Good thing i wont be there for long
cons:
-Pay is low and will never match the cost of living forcing you to get a second job. (there are several meetings every year which are a waste of time reassuring employees that a potential geographical pay is in discussion that we have not seen yet) 
- No steady over time opportunities
- Medical and dental plans are horrible (Super high deductibles)
- No room for growth in this company unless you know some one at the top.
- Unequal treatment of employees. (Preach that the operation is a team effort but allow the slower workers to slack off and give their work to the faster employees)
- Parking is a nightmare ( No grace period given and no guarantee as to when the shuttle busses will pick you up to bring you to the actual building where you then have to go through security as if though you were boarding an airplane) on a good day it will take you about 15 to 20 min to get into your actual office from the parking lot. As a result this lowers your yearly review 
- No cell phones allowed in the facility.
- Outdated computers and a horrible.... And I Mean horrible on site IT who gets mad if you wake her up from her sleep. but even if you do get her up 90% of the time she doesn't even know how to fix the problem.
